An intern encrypted the flag with RSA, but carelessly chose both primes as Blum integers. Recover the message: 5499493754665990127898096824251457661815028892478507468040966207124448748468616887253075719984361046680580202485696859765785880091033964441845903218319486

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6309351201472776672763064355180983051609478265520786815622419868084973294844034487116112342963776525237973121827580703659100755985465176693929331789117613, e=4976058708449056893233470867975388168836425430075028218192060877590849952544421609197221922772232219308368996874541401902210696500868182960897096311974359
The lower 104 bits of p are: 28194664656512988254199513532806260763


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{pv2xz543}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5499493754665990127898096824251457661815028892478507468040966207124448748468616887253075719984361046680580202485696859765785880091033964441845903218319486
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6309351201472776672763064355180983051609478265520786815622419868084973294844034487116112342963776525237973121827580703659100755985465176693929331789117613, e=4976058708449056893233470867975388168836425430075028218192060877590849952544421609197221922772232219308368996874541401902210696500868182960897096311974359
The lower 104 bits of p are: 28194664656512988254199513532806260763

extra_info: p=106493996450451891322102798162322610154093247276008937998468284986995526395931, q=59246074067736838004854445955651586762081723055895732638567110652934468075223, Ï†(n)=6309351201472776672763064355180983051609478265520786815622419868084973294843868747045594154234449567993855147630664528688768851314828141298289401794646460
